block.p: Tina Kelley and Peter Montgomery Newman were married yesterday by the Rev. Greg Peters, an Episcopal priest, on the Skansonia Ferryboat in Seattle.

The bride, 37, is a reporter on the Metropolitan news staff of The New York Times. She graduated cum laude from Yale University. The bride will keep her name professionally, and will be known otherwise as Mrs. Kelley-Newman. She is the daughter of Isabella and Frank Kelley of Brookside, N.J.
Tina Kelley and Peter Montgomery Newman were married yesterday by the Rev. Greg Peters, an Episcopal priest, on the Skansonia Ferryboat in Seattle.

The bride, 37, is a reporter on the Metropolitan news staff of The New York Times. She graduated cum laude from Yale University. The bride will keep her name professionally, and will be known otherwise as Mrs. Kelley-Newman. She is the daughter of Isabella and Frank Kelley of Brookside, N.J.

The bridegroom, 27, is developing a new company in Brooklyn, called Gotham Software, that will create computer software for the financial services industry. He graduated from the College of Wooster in Ohio. He is the son of Ruth Warner of Portland, Ore., and Gerald Newman of Ellensburg, Wash., and the stepson of Barbara Clements and of the late Fred Warner.
